Name: Stout Fellow
Ingredients: 30 ml Jamaican-style overproof aged pot still rum
30 ml De Kuyper Crème de Cafe
5 ml De Kuyper Brown Crème de Cacao
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of grated 85% cacao chocolate.
SHAKE all ingredients with ice. (BEWARE - the stout may be explosive in your shaker so hold both ends more firmly than usual.)
Garnish with a dusting of chocolate shavings.
Review: In a similar style to an Espresso Martini but with very different ingredients including Guinness stout and coffee liqueur in place of espresso coffee.
History: Created in 2013 by Matthew Coates (M.C.) at Jake's Bar and Still Room, Leeds, England. Matthew was one of five finalists in the Difford's Guide Beer-tail Competition for London Cocktail Week 2013 held on Friday 9th August 2013 at Simon Difford's Cabinet Room in London. Matthew told us, "The inspiration behind my cocktail comes from my love of all of its components – rum, beer (Guinness) and coffee. I call my drink 'a stout fellow' because it's strong and hearty but also warming and 'friendly'. It also refers to the old Guinness advertising of 'Guinness for strength' encompassing more than one meaning of the word stout."
